title: Number of active United Nations peacekeeping missions

peacekeeping.title: Peacekeeping mission
peacekeeping.content:
UN peacekeeping operations are typically deployed to support the implementation of a ceasefire or peace agreement, they are often required to play an active role in peacemaking efforts and may also be involved in early peacebuilding activities.

Peacekeeping missions are just one of several activities carried out by the UN in conflict and security operations. The others, which are distinguished from peacekeeping, include conflict prevention and mediation, peacemaking, peace enforcement, and peacebuilding.

The boundaries between these activities is increasingly blurred. Peace operations often involve one or more of these activities working in tandem with another.

subtitle: Shown is the number of active [peacekeeping missions](hover::general::peacekeeping) – not the number of new missions – in a given year. Since the UN does not have its own military it relies on contributions from member states.
